channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The Ukrainian government, however, strongly deplored the agreement on the pipeline which it sees as a political weapon to be used by Russia.
item.title: Merkel declares Nord Stream 2 pipeline deal with US ‘good’ for Ukraine

item.description: In the five years from 2015 to 2019, G20 governments provided $4.5 trillion of direct support to coal, oil and gas, and fossil fuel-fired power generation.
item.title: The world’s biggest governments are still propping up fossil fuels

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: Melbourne University students and academics are now mobilising against the Robert Menzies Institute, which counts conservative commentator Peta Credlin and the IPA chairman on its board.
item.title: Liberal-aligned institute considered La Trobe, Monash before striking Melbourne Uni deal

item.dc:creator: Annika Smethurst
item.description: Shrinking donations as a result of the pandemic are set to force parties to review strategies in the lead-up to the state and federal elections.
item.title: Political war chests crushed by COVID as regular donors keep their money in the bank

item.description: The ASX is set to open lower despite Wall Street edging higher, as investors reviewed the latest corporate earnings and a surprise increase in the number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits.
item.title: Wall Street swings higher but ASX set to open in the red

item.description: What was once largely the domain of big government is now increasingly the realm of Big Tech. The people who sold you the internet will now sell you the moon and the stars.
item.title: The Amazonification of space begins in earnest

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: Workers and students who have lost paid work in NSW due to the lockdown are missing out on federal COVID disaster payments because they already receive support payments like youth allowance.
item.title: The people missing out on COVID-19 disaster recovery payments

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: Millions of NSW residents are set to vote in local council elections within weeks, despite Greater Sydney and parts of regional NSW being in lockdown.
item.title: ‘It’s a shemozzle’: Calls to postpone council elections due to COVID outbreak

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: If you think the Olympics are past their use-by date, consider the incredible journey of this Australian athlete.
item.title: From Jimmy Brings in quarantine to an Olympic dream come true

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Health experts say poor communication of scientific advice on COVID-19 vaccines has undermined AstraZeneca while the nation’s peak medical group wants more transparency around decisions.
item.title: Doctors seek better communication, more transparency from expert vaccine group

item.description: Some students may despair, but parents, teachers and medical practitioners must not. They can help teenagers confronting the mounting stresses of multiple lockdowns.
item.title: Locked down, demoralised, demotivated: why this HSC cohort has done it especially tough - and what we can do to help

item.dc:creator: Andrew Charlton
item.description: More than half the nation is locked down, but this time around we’re more confident, we’re buying more and we’re developing habits that will stay with us long after the pandemic.
item.title: Living la vida lockdown: how Australians are adapting to the isolation economy - and spending up

item.dc:creator: Annika Smethurst
item.description: While the program has been popular with owner-occupiers, solar panels have been installed on fewer than 1500 rental properties three years into the scheme.
item.title: Calls to overhaul solar panel scheme for renters amid slow take-up

item.dc:creator: Chris Vedelago
item.description: A 16-year-old policy that stops alleged gangsters from doing business at Crown and on the track may be declared legally invalid.
item.title: Police may lose legal power to ban suspected criminals from casino, racetracks

item.dc:creator: Jake Wilson
item.description: In Jolt, Kate Beckinsale’s character has violent impulses restrained by electrical shocks. It’s a zany concept that should have been played more deadpan.
item.title: Plenty of build-up in Kate Beckinsale’s new movie, but no pay-off

item.description: Several airlines, banks and technology websites were coming back online after the third such widespread incident in two months, raising alarms across social media.
item.title: Websites of airlines, banks and tech companies back up after global outage

item.description: The musician said he would “not perform on any stage where there is a discriminated audience present”.
item.title: Eric Clapton refuses to play at venues requiring proof of vaccination for audience

item.description: It is welcome news that the International Olympic Committee has selected Brisbane to host the 2032 Summer Olympics.
item.title: Golden opportunity for Brisbane to make Australia proud

item.dc:creator: Henrietta Cook
item.description: They delivered the retailer record growth in 2018 and sparked a frenzy among customers. But Coles has now announced it will no longer give away plastic toys.
item.title: Coles ditches plastic collectible toys in bid to reduce waste

item.description: Leaders may think they are empowering when in reality they’re disengaging.
item.title: Is it delegation? Or is it laziness?

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today’s interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target Time and Superquiz, Friday, July 23

item.description: Whether it’s for a job well done or driver courtesy, let’s give each other a nod and show a little gratitude.
item.title: Small gestures of appreciation make a big difference

item.dc:creator: Harry Hollinsworth
item.description: Going solo, mail piles up and Danny rolls with it.
item.title: In the Herald: July 23, 1975

item.description: On July 23, 1934, Don Bradman and Bill Ponsford created a new Test partnership record, adding 388 runs for the fourth wicket in Leeds, England.
item.title: From the Archives, 1934: Bradman, Ponsford, break partnership record

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: If you notice a certain distracted quality during Zoom meetings, it’s probably because attention is wandering off in the direction of the Tokyo Olympics.
item.title: Livingstone Zooms in from Olympic pool deck

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: The Prime Minister is doing his job in testing the ATAGI advice on questions that cannot be left to the doctors alone.
item.title: Morrison tackles medical advice at heart of vaccine program

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian has made her strongest plea on COVID-19 vaccination, urging under 40s to consider getting AstraZeneca as Sydney prepares for its outbreak to worsen in the coming days.
item.title: Premier’s plea: Consider AstraZeneca if you are under 40

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 23, 2021

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: For the first time in almost three years, an NRL game featured a scoreless first half as the Raiders continued a late charge before the finals.
item.title: Blank canvas the perfect platform for colourful finish as Raiders edge Eels in thriller

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Australia’s under-23 men delivered a seismic upset on their return to the Olympic stage with a famous win that rocketed them to the top of Group C.
item.title: ‘We are here to compete for gold’: Olyroos stun Argentina to get Games campaign off to a flyer

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 22, 2021

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: A worker at a Melbourne hospital tests positive for COVID-19, the PM promises to make up for lost ground when it comes to the national vaccine rollout and NSW’s exposure sites continue to grow.
item.title: As it happened: NSW records 124 new local COVID-19 cases; Victoria records 26 new cases

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: For all the scandal and drama around the West Coast Fever v Melbourne Vixens match-up, their delayed game on Thursday night was an uneventful win for the WA side.
item.title: Fever get final word in Vixens stoush

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: First Nations soprano and composer Deborah Cheetham says the state government hurt the arts and reconciliation by not letting her broadcast her opera online.
item.title: Arts anger after ‘disgraceful’ decisions to reject rehearsal bubbles

item.description: The first rule of a lock-in is no-one says it’s a lock-in.
item.title: Sarah Moaney to skip tonight’s ceremony

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: Two of the 26 local cases were out in the community while infectious. One person only stopped at a regional petrol station, while the other case, linked to the AAMI Park outbreak, visited several stalls at Prahran Market.
item.title: Victoria records 26 new local cases as Prahran Market listed as COVID-19 exposure site

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Masks will stay for at least another week in affected parts of Queensland, but experts say the extension signals a change in how health authorities are managing outbreaks.
item.title: Another week of masks signals shift in Queensland’s pandemic response

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Epidemiologists say hidden chains of transmission in Victoria’s Delta outbreak may be going undetected because contacts are not required to be tested until day 13 of their isolation period.
item.title: ‘Major weakness’: Thousands of COVID-19 close contacts not yet tested

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: With an historic 11-year head start, economic and tourism experts have also warned more immediate benefits flowing from the Brisbane 2032 announcement would likely be from publicity alone.
item.title: Businesses urge early insight into historic 4000-day Games project pipeline

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: The Matildas got their Games off to a flyer on Wednesday but Graham Arnold’s men have a tough task to kick off their Olympics tilt. Coverage from 7.30pm.
item.title: Tokyo Olympics as it happened: Olyroos win 2-0 against Argentina

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Parramatta don’t have Mitchell Moses but they do have the chance to go third and six points clear of fifth against a Canberra side looking to keep touch with the eight.
item.title: NRL 2021 as it happened: Eels 10-12 Raiders at Cbus Super Stadium

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Tokyo’s coronavirus cases have jumped to their highest level in six months just over 24 hours out from the Olympics opening ceremony.
item.title: Tokyo coronavirus cases surge ahead of opening ceremony

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: It’s too late for this season, perhaps, but the AFL and its players should be rolling up their sleeves as soon as possible.
item.title: The case for AFL players rolling up their sleeves for vaccination

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The integrity unit is investigating allegations the NSW hooker breached biosecurity protocols by smuggling a woman into the Blues’ bubble.
item.title: NRL investigates Koroisau over alleged Origin bubble breach

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: This is the spine-tingling montage, narrated by coaching legend Lawrie Laurence, that will set the scene for Australia’s assault on the Olympic pool in Tokyo.
item.title: ‘We only take the best’: The video to inspire the Dolphins in Tokyo

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: “I could feel that this plan revealed a lack of respect for common sense and an arrogant attitude towards science,” one of Beijing’s top health officials said.
item.title: China refuses to co-operate with second WHO investigation into possible lab leak

item.dc:creator: Adam Piovarchy
item.description: Apologies assure others that you value a certain standard and acknowledge that you have not done enough to meet it.
item.title: Why we wanted the Prime Minister to say ‘I’m sorry’
